Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a buff-coloured pottery vessel, the exterior is covered with a cream-coloured slip and very faint traces of at least four lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Curator's comments: To be published by J. Cromwell
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393236) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393236)
